Posts.Content: Christinadukie wrote: Hi, I have posted before and I appreciate all the feed back. I got a birads 3 report at my first screening ultrasound after a negative mammogram. I have what is thought to be a fibroadenoma. 1 cm. Also a complicated cyst,( doesn't concern me as much, I have fibrocystic breasts. Can anyone who is been through the watchful waiting schedule of every six month rescans tell me a positive personal story of getting to the other side?.. Anyone get there without eventual biopsy, due to suspicious changes?. Trying to build a positive mental loop. Thanks ;) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone with positive birad three storries. :) Christinadukie Christinadukie

Posts.Content: Christinadukie wrote: Hello. I am a 42 year old with a family history of breast cancer. I have been seeing a breast surgeon since I was 38, do to breast cysts. I get regular breast mammograms and this year asked to add ultrasound as well. My mammogram came back negative for cancer. My ultrasound showed 2, " probably benign lesions".. In my left breast, simple cysts in my right breast. The birads three lesions are considered most likely to be a benign fibroadenoma, very small and a slightly complicated cyst... My concern is, with my family history,( known to both my surgeon and my radiologist), can I even afford to wait six months, for the followup ultrasound...Scared... The reccomendations at this time is watchful waiting. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Birads three. Should I wait, six months Christinadukie Christinadukie

Posts.Content: Christinadukie wrote: I have one that is going to be followed up in six months with ultrasound. I am very afraid it's something else. The breast surgeon and the radiologist think no biopsy is necessary at this time. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone misdiagnosed with fibroadenoma? Christinadukie Lala-44
